subject: Re: [junit] JSP Validation (Was: HTML/XHTML Validation w/JUnit)
msgSnippet: ... Is it? Then I stand corrected. I guess one would say, valid, for DTD such-and-such. Thanks for clearing that up. -- J. B. Rainsberger, Diaspar Software
messageBody:
Yagiz Erkan wrote:

> > "well-formed XML" meaning all the tags open and close properly, and
> so on.
> > "DTD/XML schema conformant" meaning that the document conforms to a
> > DTD/XML schema.
>
> I think the second one is called a "valid" document. So a "Valid" XML
> document
> is "Well Formed" and is "Schema/DTD conformant".

Is it? Then I stand corrected. I guess one would say, "valid, for DTD
such-and-such."

Thanks for clearing that up.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
